required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain, Psychological, and Endocannabinoid Responses to Yoga in Breast Cancer Survivors With Chemotherapy-induced Neuropathic Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Pain, Psychological, and Endocannabinoid Responses to Yoga in Breast Cancer Survivors With Chemotherapy-induced Neuropathic Pain

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the acute effect of aerobic exercise and yoga on pain, plasma levels of endocannabinoids, and mood (i.e., mood disturbance and anxiety). Participants will complete three separate sessions on different days. The first session is a familiarization session in which participants complete questionnaires and are familiarized with the experimental protocols. During the second and third sessions, outcomes are measured before and after the participants complete either 44 minutes of moderate aerobic exercise (i.e., walking on a treadmill) or 44 minutes of yoga.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The proposed study is an acute, single group, crossover pilot study where participants will complete two different experimental conditions: aerobic exercise and yoga.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Neuropathic Pain Sensations as determined by VAS
primary_outcome.time_frame: This will be measured 2 times during each experimental session- once before the assigned exercise task (i.e., baseline) and once upon task completion (i.e., approx. 50 mins later), approximately week 1 and week 2 on study.
primary_outcome.description: Visual analog scales (VAS) will be used to assess the intensity of the following sensations specific to neuropathic pain: pins and needles, tingles, stinging, and electrical pain sensations. The VAS is measured on a 100mm scale ranging from "No Pain" to "Worst Imaginable Pain."

primary_outcome.time_frame: This will be measured 2 times during each experimental session- once before the assigned exercise task (i.e., baseline) and once upon task completion (i.e., approx. 50 mins later), approximately week 1 and week 2 on study.
primary_outcome.description: The minimum cold temperature needed to elicit a pain response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total mood disturbance (Profile of Mood States)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This will be measured 2 times during each experimental session- once before the assigned exercise task (i.e., baseline) and once upon task completion (i.e., approx. 50 mins later), approximately week 1 and week 2 on study.
secondary_outcome.description: 65-item self-reported mood questionnaire that measures mood "right now." Scores range from 0-200 with higher scores indicating higher mood disturbance.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This will be measured 2 times during each experimental session- once before the assigned exercise task (i.e., baseline) and once upon task completion (i.e., approx. 50 mins later), approximately week 1 and week 2 on study.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of 2-AG, one effector of the endocannabinoid system

arm_group.description: 44 minutes of moderate intensity walking on a treadmill.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of breast cancer (stage 0-III),
- no evidence of active disease (i.e., recurrence, bone metastases, etc),
- presence of painful polyneuropathy, with onset coinciding or developing after receiving chemotherapy agents that in the opinion of the research team is likely to have caused such symptoms,
- at least six months since last active cancer treatment, with no further planned treatment (Note. active treatment is defined as surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation),
- the participant agrees to use the safety stop feature on the treadmill if needed,
- at least 18 years of age,
- and their physicians has provided consent for them to participate in yoga and aerobic exercise sessions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing current chemotherapy or radiation treatment for cancer,
- taking anticoagulant therapy,
- uncontrolled medical conditions (i.e., uncontrolled hypertension, heart disease, stage 4 liver disease, end-stage renal disease, end-stage pulmonary disease, etc),
- stroke or myocardial infarction in the past 6 months,
- being pregnant or planning to become pregnant,
- severe mobility constraints (e.g., confined to a wheelchair),
- having a history of light headedness or fainting during blood draws or physical activity.

overall_official.affiliation: Professor of Kinesiology- Exercise Psychology, University of Wisconsin-Madison

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
